column4: I'm having network connectivity issues with non-ubuntu linux distribution. Would anyone like to help, or suggest a more appropriate channel?
what distro?
i'm pretty sure they hare defunct
you could just go with ubuntu-minimal and cups
or lpr/lpd
thanks but would any of those run from one floppy? no hdd?
uhm.. no. you'd have to boot someone and load in to ram
with no hdd
ubuntu is too big but there are other distro's i'm sure that may floppy load
http://www.linuxlinks.com/Distributions/Floppy/
thanks for the tip. Maybe I can find a suitable replacement.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mini_Linux
I would find something thats a little more supported
problem being the newer kernels are so big. thats why you 're goign to be stuck with an older kernel.
yes, more supported would be nice. I was hoping to get this working on my old slow pc though. I'll keep fiddling and look at the links you suggest.
yeah it can be done.
would be much easier with an old hdd
I may have to go that route. I probably have an old hdd. I just thought it'd be cool to have a print server running from floppy. :)
would be neat and can be accomplished
especially since the ONLY things it needs to do is print and be on network.
FYI I got things working with the floppy Linux print server. I used Winimage according to instructions. Earlier I had tried dd.
I still don't understand why dd if=/path/filename.imz of=/dev/fd0 didn't work.
but at least my print server is working now from floppy.  :D
